definition: to offer shelter/to have sb in one's care
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
old variant of 留[liu2]
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
old variant of 留[liu2]
shelter/refuge

sentences.english: Bienvenu have to accept his master, warm hospitality he stay for dinner. And Ran.
sentences.chinese: 卞福汝主都收留了他，热情地招待他吃饭住宿。

sentences.english: Dora decided to take an unwanted pet in.
sentences.chinese: 多拉决定要收留一只被弃养的宠物。

sentences.english: Adult children, particularly sons, were expected to take in their parents. End of story.
sentences.chinese: 成年子女，尤其是儿子，理应收留父母。

sentences.english: They knew they might lose it by sheltering Jews, but they did it anyway.
sentences.chinese: 他们晓得在家收留犹太人，可能会连这个家也失去。

sentences.english: A. Good for you to take Tom and Betsy has her mate now.
sentences.chinese: 你收留汤姆真不错，贝奇也有个伴了。

sentences.english: But allowing deportable immigrants to stay is costly, says Mr.
sentences.chinese: 不过比鲁埃说，收留这些非法移民成本巨大。

sentences.english: If a fucking dingo follows you home, you should not keep it.
sentences.chinese: 如果一个被激怒的野狗尾随你到家，你不要收留他。

sentences.english: The child is being cared for by the local youth services.
sentences.chinese: 这个孩子现在被当地的青年服务站收留了。

sentences.english: Perhaps the innkeeper paid dearly for housing the Son of God.
sentences.chinese: 可能旅馆老板为收留上帝的儿子付出了昂贵的代价。

sentences.english: He also had a sister in southeast Arkansas who was willing to take him in.
sentences.chinese: 他在阿肯色州的东南部有一个妹妹愿意收留他。

sentences.english: A church volunteer, he was delivering meals for a homeless shelter.
sentences.chinese: 当时他是在为一家无家可回者收留所送饭。

sentences.english: Poor forest guards to see it, we decided to shelter it.
sentences.chinese: 守林人看它可怜，便决定收留它。

sentences.english: Nor does Mauritania feel obliged to keep them.
sentences.chinese: 茅利塔尼亚也不觉得有收留他们的义务。

sentences.english: As a young woman in my early 20s, I once took in boarders .
sentences.chinese: 作为20世纪早期的年轻女孩，我曾经收留过寄宿者。

sentences.english: The old man took in the lost backpackers for the night.
sentences.chinese: 老人收留迷路的背包客在家里过夜。

sentences.english: They harbored refugees in times of war.
sentences.chinese: 他们在战争期间收留难民。

definition: to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
homeless
to rescue
to meet with misfortune/to fall into dire straits
orphan
no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
orphan
to stay with sb/to ask for lodging
shelter/refuge
a benefactor/a person who has significantly helped sb else
to rely on help from sb
to place in the care of sb (a child, pet etc)/to foster/to board out
foster father/adoptive father
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
to have lost both one's parents
solitary and impoverished (idiom)
